page.title: 18Tisbury Main Services
page.content: In 1911{water}was brought to Tisbury by mains. However, Court Street did not have water from mains until some time later. If you listen outside Court Street Farm you can hear running water and this is where Tisbury used to get its water from. There used to be an{electricity company in Tisbury which got its power from the water mill turbines and it supplied electricity to the whole of Tisbury and Wardour. In 1930 Wessex Electricity Company took over production but in 1938 production of electricity in Tisbury ceased. Parish records show that{gas}used to be used for street lighting. The average size of a Tisbury family 100 years ago was larger than it is now but the population of Tisbury is about the same.
